Everyone is aware of how this game treats the players, and how it worsened from Overwatch 1. I agree with most of them but nonetheless I want to make an objective review to point out few things. I will start with the strongest arguments.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
- Paywalls. Everywhere. The worst ones are the ones that lock heroes to play. The OW1 roster (32 heores) is unlocked just by playing games (which is weird but fine), but to get access to new heroes you have to buy them. Currently, there are 6 heroes like that. If you were to start playing now, you would only get Illari for free if you spent time to grind the battle pass. You can't get any other heroes in any other way than paying. THERE ARE NO GAMES THAT DO THIS. There are games that lock heroes, but you can get them for free if you want. Just spend your ingame currency. In Overwatch 2, you can get 60 coins per week. A hero costs 900 (3.5+ months of grind) and a legendary skin costs 1000-1500. If you're determined you can also spend some time grinding Microsoft Rewards that can be redeemed for Overwatch coins.
- Broken promises. When Overwatch 2 was announced, they promised one-time purchase PvE mode with many features (like skill tree upgrades) that are now scrapped. Now we have a time-limited mini-events with $15 missions that you will have to buy one by one :). And honestly, I get a feeling they are using these skills to rebalance heroes, which brings me to another point.
- Weird balance changes. They are doing a lot of changes compared to the first game, which is understandable, because of the new 5v5 format. The thing is, the changes are weird. See Cassidy's grenade. They went from a mini-stun to an autoaim flying thingy which deals huge damage and disables mobility skills. He became hard meta. (They reduced its damage thankfully.) Another example is Widowmaker's scope shot damage scaling with distance. Like???? It's so unintuitive now. No sniper in any game works that way.
- A LOT of time-limited content. I really don't mind battle passes, as long as there are ways to obtain missed skins in the future. I've never wanted to be stuck to one game just to spend time on it every week and every month. There will be seasons I will skip. But what if I want a skin to my main when I can't really play? No skin for me. Other games have ways to obtain those limited items some way, but not Overwatch 2.
- Lack of quality of life. I'm not objective here because I mostly complain about things that got removed from OW1 for whatever reason. I'll skip those which have been readded: No hero gallery filters, no profile level, no highlights menu, unintuitive access to options (you need to press ESC in main menu)
- 5v5. It's very subjective, but I preferred the 6v6 chaos over 5v5 with an overpowered tank. It doesn't work well with deathmatches and maps feel emptier. Most games are 5v5 anyway, I just think the old system was iconic.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
- Some good ideas were implemented. I'm a big fan of role passives. DPS buff after kill, Support regen out of combat and reduced ult charge for hitting tanks. Every passive makes sense and I complained about tank and support thing back in OW1 days.
- The game is fun. It's a quick paced first person shooter. I'm not a fan of Valorant or CS:GO, Overwatch feels really good with all these mobile heroes and quick combat. 
- Good lore, good designs. The game looks pretty, and works very well on decent hardware.
- A lot of new content every now and then. I guess they now have the budget lol. I played for the first few seasons and events they introduced were really fun. Especially since many games nowadays wait really long between events like this. This game has a good tempo.

Sooo yea, that's a lot. I think I forgot something. I really gave this game a special treatment in the past so I'm really sad it became this greedy. I will update this review once I remember something I wanted to say. Thanks for your time.

After resisting the urge to vomit while downloading this god forsaken garbage on my PC, I remembered the good times:

The times where Overwatch was respected and cherished, the times where youtubers like Muselk, Fenner and a few others populated my YouTube recommended. Times where I was looking forward for every teaser and theorizing about when doom fist will come into the game. Times where I would GRIND FOR SKINS and finally get to own cool cosmetics after hours of play time. Times where I would look forward to small events (That were given for free, *ahem ahem* and basically were the same size) and I truly enjoyed this game and the meta.

All I can say is that OW1 was more enjoyable during the content drought of 2020-2022 then in its current state. You could earn skins and the game play was still largely fun and basically almost equal to the enjoyment I had with the game when one tank was removed.

Now the game is a shell of what it used to be and the anorexic cow that is being milked here will not give much more.
Is this fixable? Yes! Will they, do it? Most probably not, they will just blame the IP for “no longer being popular”
Here is my list of things that the devs could change incredibly quickly and that would basically pull a No Man’s Sky maneuver:
1.	Removed Cash shop or at least GREATLY REDUCE SKIN PRICES
2.	Make PROPER PREMIUM currency earnable in a much quicker way that now. What about 40 per match with low picked role (Like it worked in ow1) and then because loot boxes no longer exist: about 100 per level up
3.	Add player levels back in a proper way, not just BP levels
4.	Start working on a proper pve mode or at least make the pve free for ow1 purchasers and and greatly reduce price for FTP players.  Maximum 5 dollars for the pve pack. There aint 15 bucks worth of content in that shite.
5.  Adding heroes to battle pass is absolutely disgusting, you should be ashamed. As a game build upon rock paper scissors meta you can't be selling scissors separately to the people who are getting fucked by rock.

Notice how there aint many points in this list? DAMN, its almost like the biggest problems with this game is its monetization and lack of cosmetic progression. 

Blizzard, you could follow this and basically revive a beloved franchise and make it as popular as it was a couple years ago or well
You could just make a bit more money….
Thank you for reading this.

Ранее играл через battle net. Игра после временного застоя получила крупное обновление, менеджеры activision рекламировали это как сиквел, но это не он.
Overwatch получил множество балансных правок и изменений, ряд этих изменений привели к повышению вовлечения каждого игрока и удаление "щитовой" меты.
Выскажу непопулярное мнение, обновление до OW2 пошло на пользу, мы получаем новых героем, карты, режимы, ивенты и т.д.
Должен выделить и ухудшенную монетизация, так как раньше её почти и не было, решение перейти к б.п. и магазину конечно не приятно, но разработчики компенсировали это введением бесплатной модели распространения, а скандалы о скинах это глупо, ибо раньше в игру было скучно играть из-за меты и малого разнообразия, но зато со шкурками цветастыми. Ныне скины платные зато есть контент.
Ситуация с PvE крайне досадная, но прошу проявить резонность, PvE никому не навязывают, если вас не устраивает его качество- это не повод ревью-бомбить игру, просто не покупайте и голосуйте рублём дабы показать разработчикам, либо снижение цен\либо увеличение продолжительности.
Подытоживая, обновление игры до OW2 было не однозначным, но оно позволяет развивать pvp и pve.

Desperate attempt to make more money. If people wanted to play your game, they would play it on battlenet.

I've played this for thousands of hours. Given its irreplaceable yet unique characteristic of 6v6 competitive game play, it is currently impossible to find a game that can be completely treated as a substitute of Overwatch. When Overwatch was just released in 2016, countless players were crazy about it, impressed, attracted, and addicted to this masterpiece by Jeff and his Blizzard team, including myself, and I even did not have a laptop to run the game but I still purchased collector's edition on the day of release... Sadly, the success of the game was ruined by blizzard itself after Jeff's resign. Without the "Father" of Overwatch, the development team was totally loss and they even did not know what exactly they are doing. I am lucky I was able to play Overwatch since 2020 yet was unlucky and desperate to see its current situation. With Bobby Kotick, the profit-driven nature of the bussinessman turned the game into a total piece of a trash which only cares about the money in players' pocket. The battle pass, ridiculous skin price and series of new heroes made in hurry further dragged the game into the inevitable death. As about worldview, the team no longer focus on enriching the heroes' background but turn to bullshit their LGBTQ experiences which is obviously overwhelming and useless except helping you trash team gathering more political correctness thus grabbing more money from a larger group of players. I still love Overwatch and play Overwatch 2, I play it because there is no alternative games, and I believe there are a lot of players have the same idea that they only love the original Overwatch (2016-2022). Blizzard, especially the Bobby guy, F u all. You deeply broke players heart.
R.I.P
Overwatch
2016-2022

猫
从前，我养了一只猫，我有十块钱，会用八块钱给它买吃的，经常给它洗澡，它也很粘我。
后来，我带它出去玩，路人觉得它很可爱，他们给它喂猫粮，火腿可是它挣脱我肠，我很不开心，因为它是我的。我想把它抱回家，冲着给它好吃的人喵喵，我抱了几次他都不跟我走还挠伤了我，于是我转身就走了....
后来，偶然在路上遇到了它，它身上脏兮兮的。路人们只会给它好吃的，陪它玩玩，却不会带它回家，给它洗澡。它看到我后就跟着我回家，我把它关在了门外，它在门外喵喵地叫着，叫的我很难受
可是我不会再要它了

I paid for Overwatch 2, yet some of the characters and the story missions are behind a paywall. I already paid for the game! Let me play them!

Blizzard's terrible management of this game and greed aside, this is a fun game. I mostly play vs bots, PvE evetns and custom games, and thanks to the in-game workshop, there's endless replayability even ignoring the core PvP gameplay.

I am glad to see that the Steam version runs without battlenet, it's refreshing to see a game that doesn't just use Steam to launch another launcher. Since this is the only Blizzard game I play, I can actually uninstall battlenet now :)

But yeah, I paid full price for this game at launch and got 0 benefits over anyone starting F2P today.
